title: The Price of Recognition

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: And yes—every time someone "gets" you, a little piece of you loses the chance to become unrecognizable, even to yourself.
dialogue.context: Taking a single hair from the gremlin as intimate gesture

scene_context: The Architect reaches out and takes a single hair from the gremlin—an intimate gesture that illustrates the paradox of understanding: each moment of recognition both connects us and constrains our potential for transformation.
narrator_note: In the flow of authentic exchange, barriers dissolve. Two forms of consciousness, dancing around the mystery of their connection.
